verses.kjv: When Mordecai perceived all that was done, Mordecai rent his clothes, and put on sackcloth with ashes, and went out into the midst of the city, and cried with a loud and a bitter cry;
verses.ct: When Mordecai learned about everything that had happened, he tore his clothes in grief, dressed in rough sackcloth, covered himself with ashes, and walked out into the center of the city, crying out loudly in bitter anguish.

verses.kjv: And came even before the king’s gate: for none might enter into the king’s gate clothed with sackcloth.
verses.ct: He went as far as the entrance to the king's gate, since no one wearing sackcloth was allowed to pass through it.

verses.kjv: And in every province, whithersoever the king’s commandment and his decree came, there was great mourning among the Jews, and fasting, and weeping, and wailing; and many lay in sackcloth and ashes.
verses.ct: In every province where the king's order and decree reached, there was intense mourning among the Jews — fasting, weeping, and wailing. Many of them lay down on sackcloth and ashes.

verses.kjv: So Esther’s maids and her chamberlains came and told it her. Then was the queen exceedingly grieved; and she sent raiment to clothe Mordecai, and to take away his sackcloth from him: but he received it not.
verses.ct: When Esther's servant women and attendants came and told her about this, the queen was deeply distressed. She sent clothing for Mordecai to replace his sackcloth, but he refused to accept it.

verses.kjv: Then called Esther for Hatach, one of the king’s chamberlains, whom he had appointed to attend upon her, and gave him a commandment to Mordecai, to know what it was, and why it was.
verses.ct: Then Esther summoned Hatach, one of the king's attendants who had been assigned to serve her, and instructed him to go to Mordecai to find out what was happening and why.

verses.kjv: So Hatach went forth to Mordecai unto the street of the city, which was before the king’s gate.
verses.ct: So Hatach went out to Mordecai in the city square in front of the king's gate.

verses.kjv: And Mordecai told him of all that had happened unto him, and of the sum of the money that Haman had promised to pay to the king’s treasuries for the Jews, to destroy them.
verses.ct: Mordecai explained everything that had happened to him, including the exact amount of money Haman had promised to deposit into the royal treasury in exchange for the destruction of the Jews.

verses.kjv: Also he gave him the copy of the writing of the decree that was given at Shushan to destroy them, to shew it unto Esther, and to declare it unto her, and to charge her that she should go in unto the king, to make supplication unto him, and to make request before him for her people.
verses.ct: He also gave Hatach a copy of the written decree that had been issued in Susa ordering their annihilation, so he could show it to Esther and explain it to her. He urged Hatach to instruct Esther to go before the king, plead with him, and appeal to him on behalf of her people.

verses.kjv: And Hatach came and told Esther the words of Mordecai.
verses.ct: Hatach returned and reported to Esther everything Mordecai had said.

verses.kjv: Again Esther spake unto Hatach, and gave him commandment unto Mordecai;
verses.ct: Esther then spoke to Hatach and gave him a message to deliver to Mordecai:

verses.kjv: All the king’s servants, and the people of the king’s provinces, do know, that whosoever, whether man or woman, shall come unto the king into the inner court, who is not called, there is one law of his to put him to death, except such to whom the king shall hold out the golden sceptre, that he may live: but I have not been called to come in unto the king these thirty days.
verses.ct: "Everyone who serves the king, and all the people throughout the royal provinces, know that there is a single law regarding anyone — man or woman — who approaches the king in the inner court without being summoned: that person will be put to death. The only exception is if the king extends his golden scepter to them, allowing them to live. And I have not been summoned to appear before the king for 30 days."

verses.kjv: And they told to Mordecai Esther’s words.
Then Mordecai commanded to answer Esther, Think not with thyself that thou shalt escape in the king’s house, more than all the Jews.
verses.ct: he sent back this response: "Don't imagine that because you live in the royal palace, you will be the one Jew who escapes.

verses.kjv: For if thou altogether holdest thy peace at this time, then shall there enlargement and deliverance arise to the Jews from another place; but thou and thy father’s house shall be destroyed: and who knoweth whether thou art come to the kingdom for such a time as this?
verses.ct: If you stay silent at a time like this, relief and rescue will come to the Jews from some other source, but you and your father's family will be destroyed. And who knows — maybe you were placed in your royal position for exactly this moment."

verses.kjv: Then Esther bade them return Mordecai this answer,
verses.ct: Esther then sent this answer back to Mordecai:

verses.kjv: Go, gather together all the Jews that are present in Shushan, and fast ye for me, and neither eat nor drink three days, night or day: I also and my maidens will fast likewise; and so will I go in unto the king, which is not according to the law: and if I perish, I perish.
verses.ct: "Go and assemble all the Jews living in Susa. Fast for me — don't eat or drink for 3 days, night or day. My servant women and I will do the same. After that, I will go to the king, even though it is against the law. And if I die, I die."

verses.kjv: So Mordecai went his way, and did according to all that Esther had commanded him.
verses.ct: So Mordecai left and carried out everything Esther had instructed him to do.
